1.name: Space: Adkins, Thompson and Carroll
1.description: Shared planning hub for Adkins, Thompson and Carroll portfolio. Houses quarterly business reviews, launch playbooks, and decision logs for the tri-regional go-to-market crew.

2.name: Space: Salazar-Ball
2.description: Lightweight personal scratchpad for the Salazar-Ball partnership. Track hiring plans, stakeholder notes, and quick retros without cluttering the main knowledge base.

3.name: Space: Elliott, Johnson and Day
3.description: Global workspace for the Elliott, Johnson and Day transformation program. Collects architecture diagrams, vendor contracts, and readiness checklists so every region executes the same play.

4.name: Space: Reid-Poole
4.description: Reid-Poole operations library. Contains SOPs, tooling inventories, and postmortems that keep support shifts synchronized across time zones.

5.name: Space: Cooper, Barajas and Pierce
5.description: Cooper, Barajas and Pierce discovery lab. Product requirements, experiment readouts, and customer feedback summaries live here for fast handoffs.

6.name: Space: Morales Inc
6.description: Morales Inc personal R&D vault. Draft technical spikes, integration proofs, and interview takeaways before promoting them into team-visible docs.

7.name: Space: Kerr and Sons
7.description: Kerr and Sons delivery control tower. Release calendars, dependency maps, and risk call notes ensure program managers stay aligned daily.

8.name: Space: Garrett-Wolf
8.description: Garrett-Wolf brand studio. Creative briefs, asset approvals, and measurement dashboards converge here for marketing and design partners.

9.name: Space: Hughes-Alvarado
9.description: Hughes-Alvarado compliance center. Policy updates, audit evidence, and remediation plans are organized so regulators get answers quickly.

10.name: Space: Jenkins, Maldonado and White
10.description: Jenkins, Maldonado and White customer success lounge. Journey maps, escalation responses, and health metrics give CSMs one source of truth.

11.name: Space: Becker, Taylor and Davis
11.description: Becker, Taylor and Davis personal innovation stack. Capture wild ideas, reference links, and half-written demos until they are ready for prime time.

12.name: Space: Murphy, Bishop and Holland
12.description: Murphy, Bishop and Holland growth engine. Campaign strategy docs, budget trackers, and KPI reviews help demand generation stay focused on pipeline.

13.name: Space: Garrison-Thomas
13.description: Garrison-Thomas private workspace. Long-form research, notebook exports, and strategic memos stay safe while drafts evolve.

14.name: Space: Schmidt, Chavez and Jacobs
14.description: Schmidt, Chavez and Jacobs engineering guild. Coding standards, design reviews, and incident libraries keep the platform stable at scale.

15.name: Space: Wilson-Ramirez
15.description: Wilson-Ramirez personal enablement hub. Training outlines, mentoring plans, and speaking notes live here for quick reuse.

16.name: Space: Rose-Parker
16.description: Rose-Parker personal operations kit. Meeting cadences, contract trackers, and automation snippets streamline the day-to-day workload.

17.name: Space: Bell-Mullen
17.description: Bell-Mullen transformation war room. Program scorecards, cross-team commitments, and daily standup notes maintain momentum.

18.name: Space: Stout-Armstrong
18.description: Stout-Armstrong customer intelligence hub. Voice-of-customer analyses, opportunity scorecards, and executive-ready summaries align the org.

19.name: Archived Space: Jones Inc
19.description: Archived knowledge from Jones Inc pilot. Kept for historical reference: contains the final retros, budget approvals, and rollout guides.

20.name: Archived Space: Dawson PLC
20.description: Archived Dawson PLC rollout library. Includes decommissioned process docs, archived cadences, and closure reports for audit readiness.
